title: How is a kpop song made? - Quora

response.answer_text: How is a kpop song made? I’m glad you asked! I’m an expert when it comes to writing KPOP songs. First, you gotta know the rules. There are lots of them, but we’ll delve into the ones I care about the most. RULE NUMBER ONE: You gotta be able to title the song. The most common way is to just use one word in English. If you get lost, just follow EXO, as they are the best at this. Here are some examples… "Growl," "Wolf," "Monster," "Tempo," "Power," "Lotto," "Lightsaber(??!)," "Lucky," "Unfair," "Angel," "Moonlight," "Mama," "Senorita," "Fancy," "Automatic," "BAAM," "View," "Sherlock," "Juliet," "Lucifer," "Evil," "Countess," "Fire," "Hello," "Haan,""Latata," "Gashina," "Heroine," "Siren," "Likey," "Signal," "Touchdown," "Happiness," "Rookie," "Natural," "Butterflies," "Dimelo," "Sunrise," "Rough," "Memoria," “Closer,” “Cupid,” “Magnetic,” “Lullaby,” “Look,” “A,” “Teenager,” “If,” “Fly,” “Sick,” “Sign,” “Idol,” “Dope,” “Run.” “Genie,” “Gee,” You get the picture. This is really important! If you can’t stick with one word, just use it twice! “Jelly Jelly,” “Boom Boom,” “Mr. Mr.,” “Dalla Dalla.” This shows you’ve been working hard and took the song title into REAL consideration. Fuck it, do it THREE TIMES! “My My My,” “No No No,” “Bang Bang Bang.” RULE NUMBER TWO: Give it an English title that you never plan on saying in the song, like not ever. “Hobgoblin,” “Spring Day,” “FXXK It.” It many cases, you can just say it in Korean. Or NOT! “Playing With Fire,” “I’m So Sick.” RULE NUMBER THREE: You must include English words in your lyrics. They don’t even have to make sense! Just throw it in there! At first, I was like “Why not take two minutes when writing your song to make sure your English lyrics are logical.” Then, I realized I was being ridiculous. Examples: “Everyday I shock! Every night I shock!" “Connect the dots, disconnect the line, Let's shine like Scorpio in the sky.” “oh my my my, You got me fly so fast…” “Sky high, sky fly, sky dope. (We still) Same try, same scar, same work…” “Let me see how you gon' treat me…I ain't no easy…” “Just close your lips. Shut your tongue." “I was meeting with friends, SHY SHY SHY!” “Why don't you know don't you know don't you know yeah…” “We gonna go rocka rocka rocka rocka rocka rocka. So fantastic - Go rocka rocka rocka rocka rocka rocka. So elastic - Fantastic, fantastic, fantastic, fantastic - Elastic, elastic, elastic, elastic, I call you butterfly." (wtf…) Great! Or, as Momoland would say, for no reason whatsoever “GREAT!” FINAL RULE: Overuse several terms like 가타, 사랑해, 보고 싶어 or 처럼 or even say 마지막처럼 in your song (Forever Young) even if you named your other song that already (As If It’s Your Last.) So, if I were to follow these rules, I’ll give it a freestyle shot. My song is called “Cat Cat Cat.” Hey baby, I’m like a cloud in the wind Sweet strawberry love with a moonlight kiss. Up in the sky too many birds. I can't see the sun. A beast on the prowl.
